citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Dogs were identified with tooth problems that have not been communicated to the attending veterinarian (AV) for
treatment:
-Male yorkie #35 had teeth that were covered in plaque and tartar, recessed gums and his lower right canine tooth was
loose to gentle touch.
-Yorkie #58 female had had teeth that were covered in plaque and tartar and recessed gums.
-Male Maltese #50 had teeth that were covered in plaque and tartar.
-Female yorkie #59 had teeth that were covered in plaque and tartar and had recessed gums. One of her canine teeth
was slightly loose when touched.
These are signs of dental disease and can cause discomfort and health problems for affected dogs. Ensure that health
problems, including dental problems are promptly communicated to the AV so that the AV can begin a treatment plan.
Male Maltese #50 was seen to occasionally shake his head. His ears had a dark buildup in them and skin was lightly
reddened. The licensee said the ears were cleaned out a few days before the inspection, however had not communicated
this condition to the AV for treatment guidance. Ear problems such as this can cause discomfort and in some cases
spread to other dogs. Ensure to contact the attending veterinarian for ear problems so that a treatment plan can be
initiated.
***Licensee has taken steps to ensure treatment for these affected dogs.
***Ensure to maintain correct from 1/23/2026 forward.

The outdoor runs of each run had not had adequate daily spot cleaning of excreta. The licensee said that a daily spot
clean has not been in the routine. To protect dog health and comfort, surfaces dogs touch, including solid surface of
outdoor runs require a daily spot clean to maint the areas clean. Ensure to maintain a routine of daily spot cleaning for
surfaces that dogs can contact.
***Item was corrected prior to exit interview.
***Maintain correct from 1/23/2026 forward.

Some dogs had mats in their hair coats:
#65 male Shih-tzu, #58 yorkie female, #50 maltese male, and #59 yorkie female. Matted hair can cause discomfort and
skin problems. Ensure that dogs' coats are maintained free from matted hair.
***Licensee took steps to begin correcting this problem prior to exit interview.
***Maintain correct by Feb 2, 2026.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Dogs were identified with tooth problems that have not been communicated to the attending veterinarian (AV) for 
treatment:  
-Male yorkie #35 had teeth that were covered in plaque and tartar, recessed gums and his lower right canine tooth was 
loose to gentle touch.  
-Yorkie #58 female had had teeth that were covered in plaque and tartar and recessed gums. 
-Male Maltese #50 had teeth that were covered in plaque and tartar.  
-Female yorkie #59 had teeth that were covered in plaque and tartar and had recessed gums. One of her canine teeth 
was slightly loose when touched.  
 
These are signs of dental disease and can cause discomfort and health problems for affected dogs. Ensure that health 
problems, including dental problems are promptly communicated to the AV so that the AV can begin a treatment plan. 
 
Male Maltese #50 was seen to occasionally shake his head. His ears had a dark buildup in them and skin was lightly 
reddened. The licensee said the ears were cleaned out a few days before the inspection, however had not communicated 
this condition to the AV for treatment guidance. Ear problems such as this can cause discomfort and in some cases 
spread to other dogs. Ensure to contact the attending veterinarian for ear problems so that a treatment plan can be 
initiated.  
 
***Licensee has taken steps to ensure treatment for these affected dogs.  
***Ensure to maintain correct from 1/23/2026 forward. 
3.1(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The outdoor runs of each run had not had adequate daily spot cleaning of excreta. The licensee said that a daily spot 
clean has not been in the routine. To protect dog health and comfort, surfaces dogs touch, including solid surface of 
outdoor runs require a daily spot clean to maint the areas clean. Ensure to maintain a routine of daily spot cleaning for 
surfaces that dogs can contact.

***Item was corrected prior to exit interview.  
***Maintain correct from 1/23/2026 forward. 
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Some dogs had mats in their hair coats:  
#65 male Shih-tzu, #58 yorkie female, #50 maltese male, and #59 yorkie female. Matted hair can cause discomfort and 
skin problems. Ensure that dogs' coats are maintained free from matted hair. 
***Licensee took steps to begin correcting this problem prior to exit interview.  
***Maintain correct by Feb 2, 2026. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
